verses.verse: Is there not a warfare to man<WH582> upon earth<WH776>? And are not his days<WH3117> like the days<WH3117> of a hireling<WH7916>?
As a servant<WH5650> that earnestly desireth<WH7602> the shadow<WH6738>, And as a hireling<WH7916> that looketh<WH6960> for his wages<WH6467>:
So am I made to possess<WH5157> months<WH3391> of misery<WH7723>, And wearisome<WH5999> nights<WH3915> are appointed to me<WH4487>.
When I lie down<WH7901>, I say<WH559>, When shall I arise<WH6965>, and the night<WH6153> be gone<WH4059>? And I am full<WH7646> of tossings to and fro<WH5076> unto the dawning of the day<WH5399>.
My flesh<WH1320> is clothed<WH3847> with worms<WH7415> and clods<WH1487> of dust<WH6083>; My skin<WH5785> closeth up<WH7280>, and breaketh out afresh<WH3988>.
My days<WH3117> are swifter<WH7043> than a weaver<WH708>'s shuttle, And are spent<WH3615> without<WH657> hope<WH8615>.
Oh remember<WH2142> that my life<WH2416> is a breath<WH7307>: Mine eye<WH5869> shall no more<WH7725> see<WH7200> good<WH2896>.
The eye<WH5869> of him that seeth<WH7210> me shall behold<WH7789> me no more<WH5869>; Thine eyes shall be upon me, but I shall not be.
As the cloud<WH6051> is consumed<WH3615> and vanisheth away<WH3212>, So he that goeth down<WH3381> to Sheol<WH7585> shall come up no more<WH5927>.
He shall return<WH7725> no more to his house<WH1004>, Neither shall his place<WH4725> know him any more<WH5234>.
Therefore I will not refrain<WH2820> my mouth<WH6310>; I will speak<WH1696> in the anguish<WH6862> of my spirit<WH7307>; I will complain<WH7878> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul<WH5315>.
Am I a sea<WH3220>, or a sea-monster<WH8577>, That thou settest<WH7760> a watch over me<WH4929>?
When I say<WH559>, My bed<WH6210> shall comfort<WH5162> me<WH4904>, My couch shall ease<WH5375> my complaint<WH7879>;
Then thou scarest<WH2865> me with dreams<WH2472>, And terrifiest<WH1204> me through visions<WH2384>:
So that my soul<WH5315> chooseth<WH977> strangling<WH4267>, And death<WH4194> rather than these my bones<WH6106>.
I loathe<WH3988> my life<WH2421>; I would not live alway<WH5769>: Let me alone<WH2308>; for my days<WH3117> are vanity<WH1892>.
What is man<WH582>, that thou shouldest magnify<WH1431> him<WH7896>, And that thou shouldest set thy mind upon him<WH3820>,
And that thou shouldest visit<WH6485> him every morning<WH1242>, And try<WH974> him every moment<WH7281>?
How long<WH4100> wilt thou not look away<WH8159> from me<WH7503>, Nor let me alone till I swallow down<WH1104> my spittle<WH7536>?
If I have sinned<WH2398>, what I unto thee<WH5341>, O thou watcher of men<WH120>? Why hast thou set<WH7760> me as a mark<WH4645> for thee<WH4853>, So that I am a burden to myself?

And why dost thou not pardon<WH5375> my transgression<WH6588>, and take away<WH5674> mine iniquity<WH5771>? For now shall I lie down<WH7901> in the dust<WH6083>; And thou wilt seek me diligently<WH7836>, but I shall not be.
